heading: Very Small Quantity Generator (VSQG)
text:
Formerly known “Conditionally Exempt Small Quantity Generator” (CESQG).Definition: Generates \(\le\) 100 kg (approx. 220 lbs) hazardous waste per month \(\le\) 1 kg (2.2 lbs) acutely hazardous (P-listed) waste per monthTypical Facility: Small physician office laboratories (POLs), small independent clinicsRequirements
Identification: Must identify hazardous waste generated
Limit: accumulate 1,000 kg waste -site time
Disposal: Must ensure waste sent permitted facility (even municipal landfill permitted state, though rare/unsafe practice; usually sent TSDF)
EPA ID: Federal law require VSQGs EPA ID number (though many transporters states require )
Manifest: federally required use manifest (though highly recommended liability protection)

text:

heading: Large Quantity Generator (LQG)
text:
Definition: Generates \(\ge\) 1,000 kg (2,200 lbs) hazardous waste per month > 1 kg (2.2 lbs) acutely hazardous (P-listed) waste per monthTypical Facility: Large academic medical centers, major reference labs, research universitiesRequirements (Stringent)
EPA ID Number: Mandatory
Storage Time: Can store waste -site 90 days. Exceeding makes lab “Storage Facility” requiring expensive permit
Personnel Training: Formal, documented classroom training required annually personnel involved waste management
Contingency Plan: Must written, detailed contingency plan distributed local police, fire, hospitals
Biennial Report: Must file detailed report EPA every two years (even-numbered years) summarizing waste activities
Closure Plan: Must plan closing waste accumulation area facility shuts
